What's BingX?

BingX is a leading global cryptocurrency exchange that empowers users with seamless spot and derivatives trading. Known for its intuitive interface, advanced trading tools, and strong security infrastructure, BingX serves both beginner and professional traders across diverse markets.

  • Comprehensive spot and futures trading
  • Low, transparent fees
  • Top-tier security protocols
  • Easy-to-use platform for all experience levels

What can you trade with BingX?

With BingX, you can trade the following:

  • Spot Trading: Quantity is measured in units of the base currency. Your account must hold enough base and quote assets to trade in both directions.
  • USDT-M Futures: Position size is measured in units of the base currency, with USDT used as margin.
  • COIN-M Futures: Position size is measured in contract units, using the base currency as margin.

USDT-M and COIN-M Futures: Hedge Mode is available by setting your Position Mode to Hedge from the BingX trading platform; otherwise, the account operates in One-Way Mode.

USDT-M and COIN-M Futures: Margin and leverage settings can be adjusted directly from the BingX trading platform.

API Key Setup Process

Follow the steps below to create and configure your API keys for BingX.

{% include 'include/warnings.html' with warning='Never share your API keys with anyone. We use industry-standard encryption to secure your credentials.' %}

1 Create a BingX Account

If you don’t already have a BingX account, please sign up here.

2 Navigate to API Management

  1. Log in to your BingX account.
  2. Click on your profile icon in the top-right corner and select API Management.

3 Create Your API Key

  1. Click Create API.
  2. Enter a name for your API key (e.g., “IsAlgo Key”).
  3. Enable the required permissions (read, Spot trading, and Futures trading).
    4. {% comment %}
  4. Ensure you understand the permissions granted and keep your passphrase safe.
    5. {% endcomment %}

4 Enable IP Restrictions and Confirm

  1. Paste our server's IP address in the IP whitelist field: {{ server_ip }}.
  2. Click Confirm and Complete any required security verifications like email or Google Authenticator code.
  3. Once verified, click Confirm to get your API key credentials.

Complete the Integration

Copy your API Key and Secret and paste them into the form. Keep them secure and never share them with anyone.
